items.title: Trump Considers Overhaul of Refugee System That Would Favor White People
items.summary: The proposals would transform a program aimed at helping the most vulnerable people in the world into one that gives preference to mostly white people who say they are being persecuted.

items.title: Trump Administration Authorizes Covert C.I.A. Action in Venezuela
items.summary: The development comes as the U.S. military is drawing up options for President Trump to consider, including possible strikes inside the country.

items.title: Trump Allies Push to Bolster Putin-Backed Balkans Leader
items.summary: An influence campaign has relied on allies of the president, including Rudolph W. Giuliani, to cast a Serbian politician as a victim of political persecution.

items.title: Schumer Calls on Trump and Vance to Condemn Young Republicans’ Texts
items.summary: The top Senate Democrat said the president and Republican leaders had an “obligation to denounce vile rhetoric,” even when it comes from within their own party.

items.title: Could a Supreme Court Ruling on Election Maps Affect the Midterms? Timing Matters.
items.summary: A prohibition on the use of race in drawing electoral districts could allow states to redraw legislative lines before voting begins next year.

items.title: A second perilous challenge to the Voting Rights Act awaits.
items.summary: The justices will decide next month whether to hear an appeal from a ruling that would shut down almost all lawsuits under the law.

items.title: Federal judge says she’s ‘inclined’ to block mass layoffs as Trump official estimates 10,000 could be affected – live
items.summary: <p>Judge Susan Illston says administration has ‘taken advantage of lapse in government functioning’; Russell Vought says his office wants to be ‘very aggressive in shuttering bureaucracy’</p><p><strong>The far-right US congresswoman <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/marjorie-taylor-greene">Marjorie Taylor Greene</a> is further distancing herself from her fellow Republicans and accusing men in her party of being “weak”.</strong></p><p>In an <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/10/14/marjorie-taylor-greene-interview-shutdown-aca-epstein-mike-johnson/">interview</a> with the Washington Post, Greene expressed her frustrations with Republicans, signaling her further deviation from the political strategies of her party, as the government shutdown beginning 1 October was slated to enter its third week.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/15/donald-trump-federal-government-shutdown-redistricting-voting-rights-act-kash-patel-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Gavin Newsom again denies parole for Manson follower Patricia Krenwinkel
items.summary: <p>California governor blocks 77-year-old’s parole for second time, saying she ‘poses an unreasonable danger to society’</p><p>Gavin Newsom this week again denied parole for Patricia Krenwinkel, who has spent more than half a century in prison for her role in the 1969 Tate-LaBianca killings orchestrated by <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/charles-manson">Charles Manson</a> and perpetrated by his followers.</p><p>Nearly five months after California’s parole board found the 77-year-old suitable for release, the governor on Monday reversed the decisionand said she “currently poses an unreasonable danger to society if released from prison at this time’”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/15/charles-manson-follower-parole-patricia-krenwinkel-gavin-newsom">Continue reading...</a>
